posts.post_content: Don't get me wrong, I love Duskdale Wurm. But I don't like how cards are getting better and better as time p\*\*\*es. Now I can't really use Enormous Baloths if I have all these Duskdale Wurms to replace it. And I love [Enormous Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enormous Baloth)!! It has sentimental value to me. Well, from a marketing standpoint, it makes sense that cards are getting better and better. If the new set has good cards, more people will buy it. Oh well...
posts.html:

Rating:

posts.post_content: Enormous Baloth is ![6](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=6&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) which is easier to play in a multicolour deck. Its also still useful in limited. Enourmous Baloth was never that great for the cost, so this card is NOT an example of power creep (there are plenty of other cards that do that :p)

posts.post_content: The amount of green in his mana cost is irrelevant, as you should already have at least two forests out (or green-producing lands/artifacts) by the time you are able to play this, no matter how many colors your deck runs.
